newsitem.title: TAIWAN: China Steel July-April pretax off 7.2 pct.
newsitem.headline: China Steel July-April pretax off 7.2 pct.

text.p: China Steel Corp, Taiwan's largest steel maker, said on Wednesday it posted a pretax profit of T$13.958 billion between July 1996 and April 1997, down 7.2 percent from T$15.037 billion from the same period a year ago.
Its July-April sales slid to T$71.949 billion from T$73.923 billion a year earlier, a company statement said.
The company's April pretax profit was T$1.8 billion on sales of T$8.667 billion, up from April's 1996's pretax profit of T$1.32 billion and sales of T$8.327 billion.
China Steel, previously state-run, was privatised in April 1995.
